objtitle.title: Letter to George Cumberland, 1 September 1800, related materials

objinfo.objsize: full sheet 19.5 x 32.0 cm.Unfolded full sheet and Leaf Size dimensions (height x width) are given according to the vertical orientation of the body of Blake's letter; see the note on Number of Leaves, below. Object 1 has been reoriented vertically in the Object View Page, as would be customary when reading the address.
objinfo.numberleaves: 2The full sheet was folded to form two leaves. The letter appears on the first recto (Object 2), first verso (Object 3), and second recto (Object 4) of the folded sheet. This folded sheet was folded further to form a sealed packet for posting. The address appears on the second verso (Object 1), which would have been the exterior of the folded packet. The unfolded full sheet views of the letter are available as Related Works on the Object View Page.

provenance.name: Collection of Robert N. Essick
provenance.note: Early history unknown, but this letter apparently passed from a member of the Cumberland family living in or near Bristol to the family of Lord Coleridge (6th Baron Coleridge) at an unknown time; acquired from Lord Coleridge by private treaty in December 1997 by Robert Essick, John Windle acting as agent. This letter was brought to the attention of Morton D. Paley by Lord Coleridge in the summer of 1997.

desc.objtitle: Letter to George Cumberland, 1 September 1800, related materials, full sheet view, Objects 1 and 2

objnote.p: The full sheet was folded to form two leaves. The letter appears on the first recto (Object 2), first verso (Object 3), and second recto (Object 4) of the folded sheet. This folded sheet was folded further to form a sealed packet for posting. The address appears on the second verso (Object 1), which would have been the exterior of the folded packet. The unfolded full sheet views of the letter are available as Related Works on the Object View Page.
Above the address, "Wm. Blake 1800" is inscribed in pencil in an unknown hand.

desc.objtitle: Letter to George Cumberland, 1 September 1800, related materials, full sheet view, Objects 3 and 4

objnote.p: The full sheet was folded to form two leaves. The letter appears on the first recto (Object 2), first verso (Object 3), and second recto (Object 4) of the folded sheet. This folded sheet was folded further to form a sealed packet for posting. The address appears on the second verso (Object 1), which would have been the exterior of the folded packet. The unfolded full sheet views of the letter are available as Related Works on the Object View Page.
